areaSection: Orihuela Costa represents the southern jewel of the Costa Blanca, stretching across seven kilometers of pristine Mediterranean coastline in the province of Alicante. This sophisticated destination sits approximately 50 kilometers south of Alicante Airport and benefits from year-round sunshine—over 300 days annually—with mild winters and warm summers moderated by Mediterranean breezes. The region's geography creates natural microclimates, with Playa Flamenca positioned to maximize sea views and minimize excessive heat. Unlike overcrowded northern Costa Blanca areas, Orihuela Costa maintains an authentic balance between development and natural landscape, with extensive pine forests and protected dune systems preserving environmental integrity. The area encompasses multiple coastal villages including Playa Flamenca, Campoamor, Cabo Roig, and Punta Prima, each with distinct character but united by Mediterranean charm. Investment in infrastructure has transformed Orihuela Costa into a modern resort destination while maintaining the relaxed elegance that attracts selective international buyers seeking genuine Spanish coastal living.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Orihuela Costa embodies Mediterranean sophistication with cosmopolitan convenience. The area hosts substantial British, Scandinavian, and Dutch communities, creating an environment where English is universally spoken and international standards are seamlessly integrated with Spanish charm. Weekend mornings begin at beachfront chiringuitos serving espresso and fresh pastries, with afternoons split between the region's four championship golf courses—Villamartín lies practically on your doorstep—or exploring the crystalline waters of La Zenia and Campoamor beaches. Evenings revolve around exceptional gastronomy, from casual seafood tapas bars to Michelin-starred establishments in nearby Torrevieja. The substantial expat community means access to international schools, English-language healthcare, and social networks rivaling major European cities. Shopping ranges from traditional Spanish markets to La Zenia Boulevard, offering 140 boutiques and restaurants. Healthcare access exceeds expectations, with English-speaking doctors, modern facilities, and proximity to regional medical centers. This isn't isolated resort living—it's a fully-formed international community where English prevails, quality standards are maintained, and sophisticated amenities support cosmopolitan lifestyles.

Orihuela Costa has experienced consistent 10% year-on-year appreciation, outperforming broader Spanish property trends. Rental potential is substantial—comparable properties command €800 per week during peak season, generating €40,000+ in annual rental income from 7-week summer lettings alone. The €625,000 investment price at €5,388/m² positions this property as exceptional value when compared to Orihuela Costa's area average of €2,100/m²—this premium reflects quality specification differentiating this asset from standard developments. Northern Costa Blanca properties command 35-40% premium pricing for equivalent specifications, making southern properties increasingly attractive to value-conscious investors. The 3-bedroom configuration appeals to family holiday rentals, extended-stay guests, and expat buyers, diversifying revenue streams. With English-speaking property management readily available and established tourist infrastructure, passive income generation requires minimal owner involvement.
